I can let it all out and feel normal!! Luvmy2girls, I loved the "Someday..."  I think I've had a 1/2 day of not worrying about bc so far...  I saw my Dr. yesterday and she told me some good news that I did not know...and hopefully it will be the case for all of you ~~  I was originally prescribed 33 treatments but will only have to have 31.  (2 days off!!!) and...  my last 8 treatments will be a boost to the tumor site.  What I did not know was that during these last "boost" treatments they treat only the tumor site and not the entire breast so the rest of the skin areas will have a break and can begin to heal.  I was so excited when I walked (or skipped) out of there.  I hope this will be the case for all of you. Posts.Content: Mar 3, 2008 09:48AM Seashell49 wrote: Hello Feb Rad Friends!!  Well... I've completed 13 treatments...today is my 14th.  I have started with some "hive like" areas which itch.  My Dr. gave me Biafene but it doesn't say on the tube it's for itching and it doesn't relieve itching so well.  I am going to see if I can get something else today.  Someone had mentioned that the area that has been exposed to the sun over the years will be where the skin reaction will be the worse.  That is the case with me, it's where my skin has been suntanned over the years.  I would have thought it would be the opposite.  I can see my treated area pretty clearly at this point.  A rectangle shaped darker area.  My tape is starting to come loose, I guess they will have to put new tape on.  They get out the blue magic marker each day and redraw the lines. I definitely have some shooting pains and soreness but not real bad. I think I'm feeling some fatigue but not sure if it was because my folks were here (from Minnesota) over the weekend and I overdid the cooking/cleaning!?  I felt like I had no energy vs. tired. I have enjoyed reading how all of you are doing and using your good tips. I've tried every aluminum free deo. and they make me stink I think...LOL!  This week I'm trying the Cornstarch baby powder.  I think someone on here was using the cooking cornstarch and I was too (oops!)  Then I read on here to get the baby corn starch.  Whoever said they are using real deo on the other armpit...I am too!!! I made myself a sticker chart with 33 squares on it.  Each day when I get home I put a smiley face sticker on the chart.  It helps to see the progress!  I think I will need something fun at the end of the chart.  Any ideas? I think we'll all have some ups and downs.  I had a good cry yesterday.  Although I've completed 13 rads and I am feeling so good for the most part... I've still got 20 to go. Seems overwhelming and I worry about this radiation being zapped into me...and let's face it...we're being treated for bc.  Most days are good tho.  :) My 3 techs who do my treatment are so nice.  I am thankful for that.  They play jazz music in the room and if anyone likes jazz... I've discovered a new artist - - Mindi Abair - - very "up" music. :) Doe, you made me laugh with your description of the fans in the treatment room because of the odor.  You are so right.  I shower my armpit just before I go...but they nearly have their nose in my pit to line up the durn machine.  I usually put on some Bath and Body Works pink grapefruit lotion (on my hands only!)  before I go.  I usually put a little drop on my side so they smell that fresh smell and not my pit..ha, ha!  (no lotion in the treatment area of course!!) Deb,  I am so glad you are finally starting today!  I hope it goes really well.  I as soo nervous for the first few days but then I got used to it.  I hope your techs are really nice... it makes it more bearable.  Keep us posted! Kajo,  I have had some pain when I take a deep breath, and it seemed like it started after my surgery in Dec.  I asked my surgeon about it and she said it was normal and would go away.  I still have it some.  My cancer was against my chest wall so I think that has something to do with it? I better get showered and head to treatment. I hope you are all doing as good as possible...and I pray for each of you every day!!! Hugs!!  Sue

I should be so excited I am done...and get on with my life... but... The Feb Rad Team does!!  Thanks you great girls!!   Tay, I hope you will feel better and better... I'm going up and down...  Still waiting for the clown to show up at the door with balloons and say "you're amazing and brave...great job!!"  LOL  I am not usually self centered...  I just know what I would do if it were someone else completing this... or.. now I will know what to do!  Also....  I did Weight Watchers 6 years ago and lost 55 pounds and have been able to keep it off by continuing to eat healthy.  I lost 11 pounds in the first 2 weeks and was so excited.  I think you can even do it online.  Anyway... that one really worked for me.  I started walking for 20 min each day also, along with the diet and I think that helped.  Just to give some encouragement.  I will say the first week or so of the diet I thought I would starve... but once I found some low "point" treats... I was ok.    Doe, you describe thoughts and emotions so perfectly.  Honestly, you need to write a book so bc patients know it's ok to feel all of these things.  Please include a chapter on "detoxing" since we have all subscribed to that from your post!!  Your snow sounds kind of pretty to me.  I had to put one of those snowmen in my yard that blows up and lights up for the winter... no real snow in NC.  Luv, don't worry - - I have not left you!!     You made me laugh when you said you are so energetic that you overdo..and then pay.  That is so me...  I go 100% one day and then the next day...time for cat nap!  The problem is...once I go 100% then I think my hubby thinks...oh good...she's all well...and then I crash...LOL  I will be checking on you all next week... and don't be surprised if you feel sad to be ending the rads...  it seems to be totally normal... Sue ~ I've been thru the teen years!  My 2 girls are now 24 and 22...but my oldest tried everything!?  I can tell that you have given the girls a wonderful Christian upbringing... some of the stuff they will do will be normal and they will for the most part hold what's right and wrong in their hearts.  We just had to take 1 "speed bump" as we called it at a time...and pray alot for their safety!  Bummer it's happening during all that's going on with you.  God must think you're amazing...since he's piled so much on your plate!    You will be glad for the 25 treatments and 9 boosts.  It will be easier on your skin in full treatment area, it can begin to heal...and I had no side effects/pain from the boosts at all... hope it's the same for you!! Tina ~ I gave my techs a picture frame on the last day...with a thank you message framed inside.  I actually added a bow and some seashells since the beach is my favorite.  I gave them a gift card to a frozen custard place for Easter... just a few ideas.  :) PA ~  just a side note... my Dr. told me that my being "small chested" was to my advantage... less side effects.  I did find this to be true.  What day do you start again?  Best wishes to you!!  Well... I'm considering an Apple Pucker tonight.  It's 80 in Raleigh and I'm sitting on the deck.  Perhaps a toast to my fine job of completing rads! Have a wonderful weekend friends!! hugs to all!! Sue xo

Posts.Content: Apr 8, 2008 10:13PM - edited Apr 18, 2008 10:10AM by Seashell49 Hello Everyone!!  Hope you are all having a good week! Laurie Luv, Your dog "Minnie" is too cute!  I was thinking... do you want to adopt me as your sister so I can go on the cruise?  (just kidding!)  It is so fun that the entire family is signing up and celebrating with you!!!  I am wondering if I did have the IMRT rads?  I read thru the info (thanks!) and I think I must have.  Duke must be "state of the art" right??  They have not posted a bill to my insurance yet...so not sure of the cost?  Oh my stars... yours was $75,000???  and you have to pay 10%?  How does it feel not to have to drive for treatments?  How is your fatigue?  Skin??  Sue Deg, I am having trouble sleeping which has never happened to me??  I may need to ask for some ambien.  I either do not fall into a deep sleep or I wake up for some reason and my mind starts thinking.  I sleep well about 1 out of 3 nights!?  I'm sorry your daughter is experimenting with some things.  My oldest experimented with everything...and I totally understand the trust issue.  We always thought the worst and had to keep her on a tight rope.  They were tough years!?  I tried to love her throughout and keep reinforcing the good behaviors.  She had been raised in church etc. and in her heart I knew she knew right from wrong.  The peer pressures and trying to be liked!?  She is now 24 and married... and doing great!  Hang in there!  I am so glad you got yourself a necklace and have some fun plans to look forward to to celebrate finishing chemo & rads!  Redo the house and do something fun with your family this summer!  You have been thru so much...continued to work... and you need to do something fun!  Your whole family needs it!!  :)  Doe, I am going to try and figure out how to see you on t.v.!  Great job!  As Luv said... you are an excellent communicator... I bet you were amazing!  That's so neat you help folks with disabilities... it must be so rewarding!  And... way to go... with your short hair and sleeve... I think you were all the more powerful... trying to help the disabled when you have your own situation!  God is smiling in your balcony!!  I am so glad you are feeling good!!  Hey... if your mean neighbor likes your hair... maybe you should keep it short... (that made me laugh!! )  Tay, so glad you are doing so well!!  Do the happy dance... you've been thru alot...and celebrate that proth!!  :) Well... I am doing good.  Now that I am done with my treatments... I am trying to start the next chapter of my life and trying not to dwell on cancer.  At least every other hour I don't think about it...and then I think..  oh gosh... that was me that did all that and how overwhelming it is!  I cannot escape from it, it's everywhere - - 1. Just when I finished my rads, my friend was diagnosed with a recurrence of bc. I so feel like I need to be there for her, she was there for me.  I have prayed about it and feel like I have the strength to be there for her.  We had a good talk and she knows I've just walked this... and she is sensitive to my emotions.  2. Every show I watch has breast cancer!?  Yesterday "Ellen" had Hillary Clinton on her show and they discussed bc as Hillary has bc as one of her main focuses! Then Kylie Minogue came on the show (that cute blonde singer) and she is a bc survivor.  Ellen proceeded to talk about her Mom and sister who've had bc...and she had a lumpectomy!  Today Oprah had a college basketball coach on...and she had had bc.  There was someone who had helped her thru her bc  that she had never met (maybe on this website?  I missed that part)... Oprah arranged it so she could meet this angel who had helped her thru her bc.  Oh gosh... time for a detox!  I think we should all go on Oprah and meet each other!!  Doe, can you arrange that for us with your t.v. connections?? Anyway..  I had some whopper shooting pains yesterday and then today I was kind of tired and dizzy?  Guess the rads are still doing their work?? I start Tamoxifen in the next day or so... can you tell I am putting it off?  I was reading the Tamox threads on here... and they are not real uplifting.  I am going to gain 25 lbs, have belly fat, joint pain, dizziness, hot flashes...  I have been praying... my SE's will be minimal!?  I have worked so hard to feel good physically/emotionally... I don't want to take it!!    But.. it may save my life! For those of you who have not finished treatments yet... Doe is right!  Plan a celebration for yourself!  This milestone will mean the most to you...and others may not think of it!  I wish I would have planned something!  It's hard to go back to the old routine... live each day to the fullest!! Ok.. you've all inspired me...  I need to sign up for the Susan G. walk!! Still praying each day for each of you! Love, Sue xoxo

Posts.Content: May 1, 2008 09:46AM Seashell49 wrote: Hi Ulla, I wonder if it is the swimming?  I saved some info on Lymphedema Prevention and here are a few points I found in the brochure that may apply: - Avoid rapid circular movements that cause centrifugal pooling of fluid in distal parts of limb - Gradually build up the duration and intensity of any exercise - Take frequent rest periods during activity to allow for limb recovery - Monitor the extremity during and after activity for any change in size, shape, tissue, texture, soreness, heaviness or firmness - Support the at risk limb with a compression garment for strenuous activity (maybe not in a swimming pool tho...) - Avoid exposure to extreme cold, which can be associated with rebound swelling or chapping of skin (is pool water too cold?) - Avoid prolonged (>15 minutes) exposure to heat; hot tub, saunas (are you using these?) **you said you are swimming very slowly..so maybe none of this applies??  but maybe it will be a bit helpful. **this is a random thought..but I know we need to be careful of cuts/infections on this arm etc.  Is it possible you got some sort of bacteria in the pool?? I hope it gets better for you dear!! Hugs!! Sue xoxo

Posts.Content: Mar 5, 2008 09:01AM Seashell49 wrote: Hello All! Today is # 16 for me... I am half way!  My shooting pains and itching get worse and worse, but I feel better than I thought I would at this point... so for that I am thankful. Doe,  Someone had recommended something to me on a different thread for open blisters etc.  I will go find the info and post it here shortly. Deb, I did feel a bit faint after my first treatment but I think it was a total case of nerves/stress.  It's scarey to be on that table being radiated for bc!  After a day or so, once I knew what was going to happen... I felt so much better.  I would definitely ask the Dr. about this if it keeps up.  You should not be receiving any rays other than the breast tissue area.  I can tell by looking at the machine/lens area that the beams only come out of a small square area.  I would ask them about this to be sure they are not radiating too large an area. Bloodwork ~  Yes, I do have blood drawn every 3rd week.  I asked the nurse what they were looking for and she said they want to keep an eye on your white blood count, platelettes etc.  Blood is made in the bones and some bones are being radiated.  They want to monitor to make sure your blood count is maintaining. Baby Corn Starch - I finally found something that seems to work!  The alum free deo's and cooking corn starch  did not work! Candy, are you in town this week??  How are you?? Luv, I hope you won't have to go for too many treatments.  I always thought it was 33 and was surprised mine was 31 (what a difference 2 days can make!!)  I asked the techs about it and they said each person is prescribed differently.  Everything I've read said 33 was the norm.  Will you have some days of just boosters? Aquafor - I have some of this but it is super thick.  My Dr. gives me Biafene and it seems to work fairly well and is real thin...easy to spread on sore skin.  Doe had mentioned Miaderm also. (order on their website or toll free #) Another day...another treatment down for each of us.  Hope you all have a good day!  ~Sue xoxo

Posts.Content: Mar 24, 2008 02:16PM Seashell49 wrote: Hello my dear Feb Rad friends!! Hope you all had a wonderful Easter!!  :) I had boost #6 today - - only 2 more to go and I am done.  It will be hard for me to say goodbye to my techs, they've been such a blessing with their kindness!  My patient navigator said it's normal to feel kind of sad about ending this chapter, it certainly becomes your life for 6 1/2 weeks.  Mary Jo over there in Western NC...so good to here from you!  Everything you are experiencing is totally normal!!  I also hit a "depressed" spot in the middle of my rads... I was doing really well and down I went?  Week 6 was wierd for me also... so if you have a few down days.. that may be normal also.  I have also felt kind of odd and flu like.  My body temp has been off and sometimes when I'm out at a store I feel like I may faint or something??  I head home at that point.  Sometimes once I eat a little something I feel a bit better.  I think Doe put it best... It's Radiation Fatigue and it's hard to describe it exactly... just feel funky!?  I know my Dr. wanted me to stay the same weight also... they weigh me each week.  I actually gained 3 or 4 pounds!? (comfort food....)  At any rate, the physics they use to calculate our treatment area, probably to a millimeter would be off a bit if a person lost 10+ pounds during the course of treatment.  I guess I would follow the Dr.'s orders for now.  Hang in there!!!  ;)  How 'bout that Carolina Basketball team?? SueDeq, hope your daughter passed her Drivers Test!  :)  I can remember when my oldest got her license... I let her take her younger sister for ice cream.  I was a nervous wreck...prayed the whole time they were gone... but it was so nice she could drive her sister here and there... and big help!!  Yes.... I am peeling!  Even tho I'm on my boosts... I'm getting these welts in the other area which itch like crazy and then bust like a blister.  All of my skin is really rough and dry.  You're right... the Tamoxifen will be my magic pill also... to keep this bc away!!  Thanks for the positive feedback on the side effects!  I like your "balanced" diet of Girl Scout cookies, Easter candy... fruits and veggies - - perfect!!  :) Tay - you are finishing a day ahead of me!!  Thanks for mentioning the night sweats.  I have started these during rads - - can't figure out if it's menopause kicking in...or rads??  I have also had trouble sleeping soundly... I keep waking up??  Does anyone know if Rads accelerate menopause for some reason?  I think I was pre-meno...but seems like I may be more into it?  Have not started the Tamoxifen yet. Doe, I loved the "Good Cry" info you posted.  Just excellent..and so true!  Glad you had your Apple Pucker! ;)  I had a half glass of wine the other night and my arms tingled.  Hmm.. maybe wine and rads is not such a good idea??  Hows the smell/taste?? Luv, you started your boosts today!  How was it??  I think you will find that they go really fast (do you have only 1 zap?) and your other skin will begin to feel better.  9 to go after today!!!!! Mpellot, you've come to the right place!  We are all feeling and experiencing what you are!!  We understand!!  I am always so "up" and positive but this bc really hits me like a ton of bricks at times!  I subcribe to Doe's article posted and cry my head off and feel better!  No one really understands the ups and downs of this but all of us who are living it... one day at a time.  I try to stay so "up" that everyone thinks I'm perfectly fine...but inside sometimes I'm not so "up."  I know how you feel.  I also have a strong faith in God and wonderful hubby and family...friends... but some days are just plain hard!!  It's ok!!  All of the people at my Rad. are so much older than me.  I do ask myself.... why am I going thru this so young??  I love old people and try to be kind to them each day... it perks up my spirits a bit.  I have a confession to make...  I snook and used real deodarant this weekend and used a razor on my unburnt section of my pit!  LOL!  I figure since I'm in the boost stage I would sneak and do this... I'm such a rebel!!  ;) Wish you all a good week!! Prayers and hugs!! Sue xoxo

Posts.Content: Mar 31, 2008 01:27PM Seashell49 wrote: Hello Feb Rad Team Friends!! Ulla, I am so sorry you are having this terrible skin reaction.  I hope some of the advice you've received has helped...and most importantly, I hope you are healing!  I am praying for you!! Doe, How was your weekend??  I hope you had some time just for you, to do whatever you wanted or had the energy to do!  I'm glad you had a good detox after watching that movie!  My hubby took Thurs and Fri off.  He wanted to go to the coast but I did not have the energy.  It was kind of a rocky weekend, not sure he enjoyed my ups and downs??  I tried to be my best, but definitely tired and emotional.  I like your "invisible wheelchair" and elephant centerpiece!  I don't look or act a bit sick...so let's not talk about it!  Yes!  You deserve a dozen roses now.... you've done an amazing job of fighting this bc each step of the way!!! Luv, you're right...we work our way down the list and check things off...but these emotions are not to be checked off.  They just keep coming "unchecked!?"  I was wondering about my fried skin... and the damage this is causing??  I am a suntan buff...but I need to stop this...  but what damage do I have from rads??  Wow, the cruise sounds like a wonderful surprise!!  I totally understand your feelings about going with a different body (what type of swimsuit to wear?) and keeping the rad area out of the sun.  How soon are you going?  Are the girls going also?  I hope you will have enough time to sort thru all of this and get the perfect wardrobe to be comfortable... and you can go and just have a fun, relaxing time - - you deserve it! 4 more treatments after today... you're getting close!!!   MPellot, Was the oncotype an extra test? or... would it have been on my path report?  Which Dr. did this for you... I have so many to chose from.. ha, ha.  I'm with Luv on the Domeboro lotion - -I would be leary of the aluminum ingredient.  My understanding was that alum. would tamper with the effectiveness of rads.  Also... the baby cornstarch powder worked the best for me also for deo.  I am starting Tamoxifen next Mon.   Have you started it already?  I am dreading the hot flashes...but it's what I've got to do.  Sue, I am having trouble sleeping also.  I have never had this problem... it must be the rads.  I wake up overheated.... not sure if I'm starting menopause in the middle of all of this??  Or...does rads goof up your body temp??  When I wake up my mind starts thinking...and I cannot get back to sleep.  I love Amer Idol too!  I think all of them are so good... I'm sad each time one is let go.  You should definitely plan something special for your last day of treatment!  I had expectations that it would be a big deal to family/friends and for the most part no one even remembered.  It was such a big deal to me and I should have planned something really fun after.  Coming home was kind of a let down.  Well... it's been 4 days since my last treatment.  My booster area is pretty red and fried, and I have had more shooting pains than I ever had...  Advil works good for me.  The rads definitely seem to be still working, even after we're thru.  Emotionally I can say I am thankful I don't have to drive to Duke.  It's cold and rainy in Raleigh, and I am cozy in my pj's.  Does anyone find it totally awkard to be a person with bc and wish you were just your old self?  I run into people that I know...that know I have bc and they don't even ask "how are you?"  I am super nice to them and ask about them...but lets not discuss bc!!?  Then... you run into someone you have not seen yet and you have to go thru the whole thing...and then they say... oh good , you're done and back to normal...  normal????  Still adjusting to the emotions and reactions of being a person with bc.  It's the elephant again.... I pray for you all by name each morn! Gentle hugs too! Sue
